meanings.sent1: The bird nidated its eggs carefully in the nest.
meanings.sent2: The turtle nidated her eggs in the sand by the shore.
meanings.sent3: The hen nidated her eggs in the coop, but the rooster kept stealing them!
meanings.sent4: The spider nidated her eggs in the corner of the room, creating a delicate web of life.
meanings.sent5: The fish nidated her eggs among the rocks, ensuring their safety from predators.

meanings.definition: To nest or settle in a place
meanings.sent1: The squirrel nidated in the hollow of the tree during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to nidate in the cozy cabin for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The cat nidated in the sunbeam, enjoying the warmth on a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree nidated deep into the earth, anchoring it firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The explorer nidated in the remote village, immersing himself in the local culture.
